desc: My project is a web-comic and six-part comic book series targeted at a niche market. The story is set on a satellite colony in the orbit of Mainland earth. This futuristic world is governed by a corporation that manufactures sex robots in order to restrain the libidinous aggression of its subjects. But after generations of these fantasy-fulfilling robots, human women are becoming obsolete. This gives rise to the resistance whose mission is to restore womanhood by bringing down the robots. The turning point arrives when news spreads that the corporation is developing a prototype robot that is so sophisticated that it is capable of replacing women altogether, resulting in the resistance intensifying their efforts to destroy the robots before this prototype goes into mass-production. The protagonist in the story was thirteen years old when she joined the resistance, and by the time the story unfolds she is nineteen years old and the resistance's biggest fanatic, that is until fate brings the prototype directly onto her path, and she begins to question everything. While my story lends itself to speculative fiction and the complex concepts and themes that usually accompany this genre, the subtext, however, focuses on two girls from opposing camps trying to negotiate an intense, forbidden and uncharted relationship. My target audience is the LGBT community, particularly lesbian identified women between the ages of 16 and 28.

desc: We are looking for a long term person to join our term with heavy experience in online analytics and segmentation. We need someone that has experience with the following programs to help us "tie together" our analytics platforms.- Google Analytics- Google Tag Manager- Piwik (we have it installed but need just a little help with initial setup)- Facebook Pixel- MixPanel- Woopra- Twitter Analytics- Web Engage- HeapAll of these platforms are setup already and running, they just need to be optimized.   We need proper segments built for customer actions and be able to very closely and accurately process and view analytics in realtime.You can either bid a flat rate per segment of work to be performed, or you can be paid hourly.   If you are hourly you will be required to use Slack chat to communicate with the Marketing Group and HubStaff that tracks your time worked.Pay, if flat rate, will be 25% upfront funded (not released) and another 50% funded once you complete half the project.  The remaining 25% will be funded on completion, all 100% will be released once we verify work in under 48 hours of notice from you.  None of this is negotiable, it will only not apply if this project is amended
